Package tools.data.array

Class Array2D<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.data.array.Array2D<V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.RandomAccess, PublicCloneable
    public class Array2D<V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PublicCloneable, java.util.RandomAccess
    This class represents a robust and fail-fast 2D array. This array allows the basic set and get operations for single elements, a (partial) row or column, and a (partial) 2D array.

    Additionally, if the component type has a primitive counter part (e.g. Integer - int), then all functions also accept primitive arrays of that counter part.
    Note that these functions are fail fast, so if an other typed object or primitive typed array is used, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

    This class cannot be used for concurrent operations since the operations are NOT atomic.

        height - The height of the array.
        Throws:

        Clone constructor. The new array will have the same size and data as the source array.
        Parameters:

      • Array2D

        public Array2D​(Array2D<V> source,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
        Copies a chunk of data from the given source array.
        The values which are copied are inside the area denoted by the given bounds.

        Examples

        Let's consider the following source: 
        
 source = [[1, 2, 3],
           [4, 5, 6],
           [7, 8, 9]];
        Then arrays are initialized as following: 
        
 new Array2D(source, 0, 0, 2, 2) = [[1, 2], [4, 5]];
 new Array2D(source, 1, 1, 2, 2) = [[5, 6], [8, 9]];
 new Array2D(source, 0, 0, 4, 4) = [[1   , 2   , 3   , null]
                                    [4   , 5   , 6   , null]
                                    [7   , 8   , 9   , null]
                                    [null, null, null, null]];
        Parameters:
        source - The 2D array to copy the values from.
        x - The x-coordinate to start copying from.
        y - The y-coordinate to start copying from.
        width - The width of the area to copy.
        height - The height of the area to copy.

        public void setSize​(int width,
                    int height)
        Resizes the array and purges the old values.
        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the array.
        height - The new height of the array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - If the given width and/or height are negative.

      • setSizeAndCopy

        public void setSizeAndCopy​(int width,
                           int height)
        Resizes the array and copies the old values. All values which are inside the new bounds will be kept, but the values outside the new bounds will be removed. Newly generated coordinates will be set to null.
        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the array.
        height - The new height of the array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - If the given width and/or height are negative.

        Copies the data inside the given bounds to a new 2D array.

        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate to start copying from.
        y - The y-coordinate to start copying from.
        width - The width of the area to copy.

        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the provided bounds are not within the bounds of this array or the source array.

      • getPrimRow

        public <T> T getPrimRow​(int y)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns a fresh primitive typed array containing values in the specified row.
        Parameters:
        y - The row to get.
        Returns:
        A primative array having the same width as this array, and contains the values in the y'th row of this array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the type of this array doesn't have a primitive type.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given y value lies outside the bounds of this array.

      • getRow

        public V[] getRow​(int y)
        Returns a fresh array containing values in the specified row.
        Parameters:
        y - The row to get.
        Returns:
        A array having the same width as this array, and contains the values in the y'th column of this array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given y value lies outside the bounds of this array.

      • getRow

        public V[] getRow​(V[] dest,
                  int y)
           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Copies the values of the row to the provided array. The indices in the destination array which lie outside the bounds of the array will remain unchanged.

        The values are copied from the y'th row.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination array.
        y - The y-coordinate to start copying values from.
        Returns:
        The destination array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given y value lies outside the bounds of this array.

      • getRow

        public V[] getRow​(V[] dest,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int off,
                  int len)
           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Copies the values of the row to the provided array. The indices in the destination array which lie outside the bounds of the array will remain unchanged.

        The values are copied from the y'th row, and are copied from the x'th index onwards.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination array.
        x - The x-coordinate to start copying values from. Default is 0.
        y - The y-coordinate to start copying values from.
        off - The offset to start placing values in the destination array.
        len - The maximum number of elements to return.
        Returns:
        The destination array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given x and/or y values lie outside the bounds of this array or the destination array.

      • getColumn

        public <T> T getColumn​(T dest,
                       int x)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Copies the values of the column to the provided array. The indices in the destination array which lie outside the bounds of the array will remain unchanged.

        The values are copied from the x'th column, and are copied from the y'th index onwards.

        If the given array is a primitive typed array, then all null values are converted to the default value the primitive type of this array.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination array.
        x - The x-coordinate to start copying values from.
        Returns:
        The destination array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the depth of the array is incorrect, or the type of the array is invalid.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given x value lies outside the bounds of this array.

                       int x,

                       int len)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Copies the values of the column to the provided array. The indices in the destination array which lie outside the bounds of the array will remain unchanged.

        The values are copied from the x'th column, and are copied from the y'th index onwards.

        If the given array is a primitive typed array, then all null values are converted to the default value the primitive type of this array.

        dest - The destination array.
        x - The x-coordinate to start copying values from.
        y - The y-coordinate to start copying values from. Default is 0.
        off - The offset to start placing values in the destination array.
        len - The number of values to set in the array.

        The destination array.

        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given x or y values lie outside the bounds of this array.

      • getPrimArray

        public <T> T getPrimArray()
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a primitive array of size [getWidth() x getHeight()] which contains the elements of this array.

        Additionally, all null values are converted to the default value the primitive type of this array.
        Returns:
        A primative array having the size of this array and containing the values of this array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the type of this array doesn't have a primitive type.

      • getArray

        public V[][] getArray()
        Returns an array of size [getWidth() x getHeight()] which contains the elements of this array.
        Returns:
        An array having the size of this array and containing the values of this array.

      • getArray

        public Array2D<V> getArray​(Array2D<V> dest,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int offX,
                           int offY,
                           int width,
                           int height)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Copies the data inside the given bounds from the source array to this array.
        If the provided width or height are negative, then the values are mirrored in respectively the width or height. The values which are copied are inside the area denoted by the given bounds.

        If the given array is a primitive typed array, then all null values are converted to the default value the primitive type of this array.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination array.
        x - The x-coordinate to start copying from.
        y - The y-coordinate to start copying from.
        offX - The x-coordinate to start pasting to.
        offY - The y-coordinate to start pasting to.
        width - The width of the area to copy.
        height - The height of the area to copy.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided width and/or height are negative.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the provided bounds are not within the bounds of this array or the destination array.

      • getArray

        public V[][] getArray​(V[][] dest)
        Copies the values from this array to the given destination array.
        The indices in the destination array which lie outside the bounds of this array will remain unchanged in the destination array.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination array.
        Returns:
        The destination array.

      • getArray

        public V[][] getArray​(V[][] dest,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int offX,
                      int offY,
                      int width,
                      int height)
               throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Copies the values of this array to the provided 2D array. The indices in the destination array which lie outside the bounds of the array will remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination array.
        x - The x-coordinate to start copying from.
        y - The y-coordinate to start copying from.
        offX - The x-coordinate to start writing the values to.
        offY - The y-coordinate to start writing the values to.
        width - The width of the area to get.
        height - The height of the area to get.
        Returns:
        The destination array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the provided bounds are not within the bounds of this array or the destination array.
